4.t: and has taught him intelligible speech.

5.t: The sun and moon rotate in a predestined orbit.

6.t: The plants and trees prostrate before Him.

7.t: He raised the heavens and set up everything in balance,

8.t: so that you would maintain justice.

9.t: Therefore, maintain just measure and do not transgress against the Balance.
9.tr: Wa-aqeemul wazna bilqisti Wa-laa tukhsirul meezaan

10.t: He spread out the earth for the people.

11.t: There exists all kinds of fruits, palm-trees with sheathed blossoms,

12.t: grain with its husk and aromatic herbs.

13.t: (Jinn and mankind) - which of the favors of your Lord do you deny?

14.t: He created the human being from clay like that used for pottery

15.t: and jinn from the many colored flames of fire.
15.tr: Wa-khalaqal jaaan mim maarijim min naar

16.t: (Jinn and mankind) - which of the favors of your Lord do you deny?

17.t: He is the Lord of the East and West through all seasons.

18.t: (Jinn and mankind) - which of the favors of your Lord do you then deny?

19.t: He has made the two oceans meet each other,

20.t: but has created a barrier between them so that they will not merge totally.

21.t: (Jinn and mankind) - which of the favors of your Lord do you then deny?

22.t: From the two oceans comes pearls and coral.

23.t: (Jinn and mankind) - which of the favors of your Lord would you then deny?

24.t: By His command, the ships with raised masts sail on the sea like mountains.
24.tr: Wa-lahul jawaaril mun-sha'aatu fil bahri kal-a'laam

25.t: (Jinn and mankind) - which of the favors of your Lord do you then deny?

26.t: Everyone on earth is destined to die.

27.t: Only the Supreme Essence of your Glorious and Gracious Lord will remain forever.
27.tr: Wa-yabqaa wajhu rabbika zul jalaali wal-ikraam

28.t: (Jinn and mankind) - which of the favors of your Lord do you then deny?

29.t: Everyone in the heavens and the earth depends on Him. His task in preserving His creation is continuous.
29.tr: Yas'aluhoo man fis samaawaati walard; kulla yawmin huwa fee shaan

30.t: (Jinn and mankind) - which of the favors of your Lord do you then deny?

31.t: Jinn and mankind, We shall certainly settle your accounts.

32.t: (Jinn and mankind) - which of the favors of your Lord would you then deny?

33.t: Jinn and mankind, if you can penetrate the diameters of the heavens and the earth, do so, but you cannot do so without power and authority.
33.tr: Yaa-ma'sharal jinni wal-insi inis tata'tum an tanfuzoo min aqtaaris samaawaati wal-ardi fanfuzoo; laa tanfuzoona illaa bisultaan

34.t: (Jinn and mankind) - which of the favors of your Lord would you then deny?

35.t: Flames of fire and molten brass will be released against you and you will not be able to protect yourselves.
35.tr: Yursalu 'alaikumaa shuwaazum min naarinw-wa nuhaasun falaa tantasiraan

36.t: (Jinn and mankind) - which of the favors of your Lord do you then deny?

37.t: (On the Day of Judgment) when the heavens are rent asunder they will have a flowery color and flow like oil.
37.tr: Fa-izan shaqqatis samaaa'u fakaanat wardatan kaddihaan

38.t: (Jinn and mankind) - which of the favors of your Lord do you then deny?

39.t: On that day there will be no need to ask mankind or jinn about his sin
39.tr: Fa-yawma'izil laa yus'alu 'an zambiheee insunw Wa-laa jaann

40.t: (Jinn and mankind) - which of the favors of your Lord would you then deny?

41.t: The guilty ones will be recognized by their faces and will be seized by their forelocks and feet.
41.tr: Yu'raful mujrimoona biseemaahum fa'yu'khazu binna-waasi wal-aqdaam

42.t: (Jinn and mankind) - which of the favors of your Lord do you then deny?

43.t: (The guilty ones will be told), "This is hell which the sinful ones denied".
43.tr: Haazihee jahannamul latee yukazzibu bihal mujrimoon

44.t: They will run around in blazing fire and boiling water.

45.t: (Jinn and mankind) - which of the favors of your Lord would you then deny?

46.t: Those who fear their Lord will have two gardens

47.t: (Jinn and mankind) - which of the favors of your Lord would you then deny?

49.t: (Jinn and mankind) - which of the favors of your Lord would you then deny?

50.t: In the two gardens there will be two flowing springs.

51.t: (Jinn and mankind) - which of the favors would you then deny?

52.t: In them there are pairs of each kind of fruit.

53.t: (Jinn and mankind) - which of the favors of your Lord would you then deny?

54.t: (The dwellers of Paradise) will recline on couches lined with silk brocade and it will be easy to reach the ripe fruits from the two gardens.
54.tr: Muttaki'eena 'alaa furushim bataaa'inuhaa min istabraq; wajanal jannataini daan

55.t: (Jinn and mankind) - which of the favors of your Lord would you then deny?

56.t: There will be bashful maidens untouched by mankind or jinn before.
56.tr: Feehinna qaasiratut tarfi lam yatmishunna insun qablahum Wa-laa jaaann

57.t: (Jinn and mankind) - which of the favors of your Lord would you then deny

58.t: who are as beautiful as rubies and pearls.

59.t: (Jinn and mankind) - which of the favors of your Lord would you then deny?

60.t: Can any thing else be a response to a favor but a favor?

61.t: (Jinn and mankind) - which of the favors of your Lord would you then deny?

62.t: Besides this, there will be two other gardens.

63.t: - jinn and mankind - which of the favors of your Lord would you then deny

65.t: (Jinn and mankind) - which of the favors of your Lord would you then deny?

66.t: In these there will also be two springs gushing forth.

67.t: (Jinn and mankind) - which of the favors of your Lord would you then deny?

68.t: In both gardens there will be fruits, palm-trees, and pomegranates

69.t: (Jinn and mankind) - which of the favors of your Lord would you then deny?

70.t: There will be well-disciplined, beautiful maidens.

71.t: - jinn and mankind - which of the favors of your Lord would you then deny

72.t: - with big, black and white beautiful eyes, dwelling in tents.

73.t: - jinn and mankind - which of the favors of your Lord would you then deny

74.t: - untouched by jinn or mankind before.
74.tr: Lam yatmis-hunna insun qablahum Wa-laa jaaann

75.t: (Jinn and mankind) - which of the favors of your Lord would you then deny?

76.t: They will be reclining on plain green and beautifully printed cushions

77.t: (Jinn and mankind) - which of the favors of your Lord would you then deny?

78.t: Blessed is the Name of your Lord, the Lord of Glory and Grace.
78.tr: Tabaarak asmu Rabbika Zil Jalaali wal-Ikraam
